text:
My motivation for this came from
my management consulting days.

We'd get brought into a lot of
hospitals and health systems

One of the kind of key
challenges in that work

is that there's quite
a bit of tension

between the managers of these
healthcare organizations

and the physicians and
other clinical staff.

Broadly speaking, I'm
interested in the status

of expert knowledge in
the firm, and especially,

how that plays out in the
tension between performance

management on the one side,
and professional autonomy

on the other side, which are
both important for health

of patients and for
efficiency of the system.

One of my favorite
things about HBS

is how much they encourage
us to be multidisciplinary.

I think a lot of
programs talk about that,
